transportAdvice: Helsinki has an efficient public transit network covering the city and tourist areas, including metro, trams, buses, and ferries, making it easy to get around without a car. The compact city centre is very walkable, and taxis are widely available though expensive.

weather.description: Cold, dark winter month with frequent snow and ice; daylight is very limited and temperatures stay well below freezing.
The coldest month of the year with persistent snow cover, icy conditions, and only a few hours of daylight.
Late winter with slowly lengthening days; snow is still common but temperatures begin to creep above freezing by midday.
Spring arrives with rapidly increasing daylight; snow melts and temperatures become milder, though cold snaps are still possible.
A pleasant spring month with long days, blooming nature, and comfortably mild temperatures ideal for sightseeing.
Early summer with near-endless daylight around the solstice; warm and lively with outdoor festivals and long evenings.
The warmest month of the year with long sunny days; popular for outdoor activities, island hopping, and city events.
Still warm and summery with gradually shortening days; a great time to visit before the autumn chill sets in.
Early autumn brings cooler temperatures and turning foliage; days shorten noticeably and rain becomes more frequent.
Cool and often grey with frequent rain and wind; the city quiets down and temperatures drop toward freezing at night.
Dark and damp with the first frosts and occasional sleet or snow; daylight hours are short and conditions feel wintry.
Cold and dark with festive Christmas markets brightening the city; snow is possible and temperatures regularly fall below freezing.
